title: Besieged residents of Mississippi town destroyed by tornado continue search for loved ones amid rubble
description: James Anderson was in bed when he heard the tornado’s roar.

title: Bragg pushes back after House Republicans escalate oversight into Trump hush money case
description: Manhattan DA Alvin Bragg has dismissed another letter by three House Republican chairmen seeking more information related to the hush money probe.

title: Trump's base splinters on Ron DeSantis
description: Donald Trump has indicated that he feels personally betrayed by Ron DeSantis' possible presidential run, and his base is divided on the prospect.

title: NATO criticizes Putin for 'dangerous' rhetoric over Belarus nuclear weapon deployment
description: NATO called his rhetoric “dangerous and irresponsible,” while Ukraine accused President Vladimir Putin of making Belarus a “nuclear hostage” with his announcement that Russia was going to store tactical nuclear weapons in the country, which both nations border.

title: Trump lawyer calls post attacking Bragg 'ill-advised,' says 'I'm not his social media consultant'
description: Donald Trump's lawyer on Sunday distanced himself from his clients' escalating attacks on Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg as he weighs criminal charges against the former president.

title: A police chase in Jackson, Mississippi, ended with an innocent woman shot in her bedroom
description: NBC News analyzed surveillance video showing a Mississippi Capitol Police officer appearing to shoot his gun in a predominantly Black Jackson apartment complex.

title: A way of life is all but extinguished by New Mexico's largest wildfire
description: MORA COUNTY, N.M. — Benito Sanchez has been living in an Albuquerque hotel room with his ailing, 100-year-old grandmother for the past year after the state's largest wildfire burned their modular home to the ground.

title: Biden declares major disaster in Mississippi as forecasters warn of more tornadoes after 26 were killed
description: The tiny rural town of Rolling Fork, Miss.

title: High rates of eczema could be caused by the air that we breathe, new research suggests
description: Eczema, the itchy inflammatory skin condition, has been on the rise since the 1970s. New research finds that pollution may be causing eczema "hot spots."

title: Third death reported in Pennsylvania chocolate factory explosion
description: The remains of a third apparent victim of a chocolate factory explosion in Pennsylvania were discovered  Saturday at the site, West Reading borough authorities said.
